0.title: Debugging Tools
0.description: Tracking temporal indices in forecasting and data science problems is both challenging and essential to avoid data leakage.  This module provides tools to create artificial datasets that help trace the temporal origins of feature values.

1.title: Forecast Plots
1.description: A tool for visualizing forecasted versus historical values of a target series.  It is designed to support comparative analysis of forecasting performance across different  forecast horizons and to report key accuracy metrics.

2.title: ML Samples
2.description: A utility for generating training and test datasets tailored to forecasting applications. This tool ensures proper alignment of target and feature data based on the forecast horizon before splitting the dataset for standard machine learning tasks.

3.title: RF Model
3.description: A set of utilities to support the training and evaluation of Random Forest models,  with specific adaptations for forecasting applications.  The functions `train_random_forest` and `evaluate_model` provide standard model evaluation on  out-of-sample data, while `evaluate_model_over_sliding_window` performs model retraining and  evaluation over a sliding window.

4.title: Time Series Plots
4.description: Provides graphical tools based on Matplotlib to visualize time series.

6.title: Gas Production Dataset
6.description: Provides a data access layer for Mexico's Gas Dataset — a comprehensive collection of data on national              natural gas production, along with various socioeconomic and industrial indicators.

7.title: Gas Output Modelling
7.author: Juan Guillermo
7.description: End-to-end implementation of a predictive model for Mexico´s gas production.  It serves two core workflows: First, we perform correlation analysis with contemporaneus and  features which summarize the national context. Second, we follow a standard ML development   process to train a predictive model over long forecast horizons.

8.title: Feature Names with Scales
8.description: Utilities for effectively working with units of measurement or scale information when included              as part of feature names.

9.title: Information Processing for Time Series
9.description: A collection of tools for common transformations in multivariate time series contexts. A recurring theme               is aligning measurements with a forecast horizon to support machine learning training workflows.

10.title: Temporal correlations
10.description: Provides several tools for a correlation analysis in a multivariate time series contexts.
